title: New Polish Space Agency Chief Named After Abrupt Exit of Predecessor
summary:
Poland’s Minister of Development and Technology has announced the appointment of Dr. Marta Ewa Wachowicz as the new President of the Polish Space Agency (POLSA). Her appointment comes less than a month after her predecessor was abruptly relieved of his duties. On 19 February, a SpaceX Falcon 9 upper stage underwent an uncontrolled atmospheric re-entry […]

title: Lockheed Martin delivers completed Orion to NASA for Artemis 2
summary:
Lockheed Martin formally delivered to NASA May 1 the Orion spacecraft for Artemis 2, keeping that mission on track for a launch in early 2026.

title: Hubble Images a Peculiar Spiral
summary: A beautiful but skewed spiral galaxy dazzles in this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image. The galaxy, called Arp 184 or NGC 1961, sits about 190 million light-years away from Earth in the constellation Camelopardalis (The Giraffe). The name Arp 184 comes from the Atlas of Peculiar Galaxies compiled by astronomer Halton Arp in 1966. It […]

title: NASA’s SPHEREx Space Telescope Begins Capturing Entire Sky
summary: After weeks of preparation, the space observatory has begun its science mission, taking about 3,600 unique images per day to create a map of the cosmos like no other.
